result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey R. Litvinoff Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
10:30 am - 15FO205 & 15CM96 - Defendant Jeffrey R. Litvinoff appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. Court questions defendant regarding right to attorney. Defendant waives right to attorney. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to charge.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. DA certifies victims rights compliance. On motion of DA 15FO205 is dismissed. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:51 am.
Court imposes: Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Conditions:  $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS and submit sample; $65 SBDA; AODA; Restitution of $1110.00 + 10% surcharge = $1221.00, J&S; Apology; Maintain full time employment.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Robert or Mary Lobermeier, unless there is written consent on file no go upon their premises at W7081 Trout Pond Rd.

Defendant Jeffrey R. Litvinoff appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
